intro: Neocollettia wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is a perennial plant characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical climates.
